data.title: The Best Movies With Butterfly in the Title
data.meta_description: Over 100 filmgoers have voted on the 80+ films on Best Movies With Butterfly in the Title. Current Top 3: The Butterfly Effect, Black Butterfly, Purple ...
data.text:
Ranked By

352 votes

150 voters

How many movies with butterfly in the title can you name? This list ranks the best movies with butterfly in the name, whether they're documentaries, dramas, horror movies, or any other genre of film. Do you have a favorite movie with butterfly in the title? Categorizing movies by words in their titles is kind of uncommon, but that's a big part of why this list is so fun to scroll through. There's probably one movie with butterfly in the title you think of right away, but you might be shocked to see how many others exist as well.

Notable films with butterfly in the title include The Butterfly Effect, The Diving Bell and the Butterfly, and Purple Butterfly, although there are many more examples on this list. This poll is interactive, meaning you can vote the butterfly movies up or down depending on how much you like them.

Most divisive: Butterfly

Over 100 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best Movies With Butterfly in the Title

Ashton Kutcher, Amy Smart, Eric Stoltz

This mind-bending psychological thriller masterfully explores the concept of chaos theory and how small actions can create ripple effects that profoundly impact the future. As the protagonist discovers his ability to alter past events, viewers are taken on a suspenseful ride through alternate realities, where every choice leads to consequences that are both gripping and heart-wrenching. With its intricate storyline, thought-provoking themes, and standout performances, this film is an unforgettable masterpiece.

Released : 2004

Directed by : Eric Bress, J. Mackye Gruber

Also ranks # 29 on The 200+ Best Psychological Thrillers Of All Time

Also ranks # 465 on The Most Rewatchable Movies

Also ranks # 35 on The 100+ Grossest Movies Ever

Melania Urbina, Magdyel Ugaz, Liliana Trujillo

A chilling psychological thriller that skillfully explores the twisted relationship between a struggling writer and the mysterious stranger who takes him captive, this film showcases superb performances from its talented cast. As the two men engage in a twisted game of cat and mouse, viewers are left questioning the nature of truth, trust, and manipulation. The nail-biting suspense and intricate character development make this movie a truly memorable masterpiece.

Released : 2006

Directed by : Francisco Jos√© Lombardi

3

Purple Butterfly

Zhang Ziyi, Li Bingbing, Toru Nakamura

Set against a backdrop of political intrigue and espionage during a tumultuous period in history, this thrilling film tells the story of a young woman drawn into the world of resistance fighters. As she battles her adversaries and navigates a complex web of alliances and betrayals, the character demonstrates resilience and determination that capture the spirit of survival. Packed with captivating action sequences and richly drawn characters, this daring tale has earned its place as one of the finest films ever made.

Released : 2003

Directed by : Lou Ye

This intense, edge-of-your-seat thriller delves into the lives of a seemingly perfect couple whose world is turned upside down when they become the target of a sadistic kidnapper. As the story unfolds, audiences are kept guessing by the film's unpredictable twists and turns, while the outstanding performances from the lead actors heighten the tension. The expertly crafted plot keeps viewers gripped from start to finish, resulting in an unforgettable cinematic experience.

Released : 2007

Directed by : Mike Barker

5

The Butterfly Story

Exploring the life of a fragile protagonist who ultimately undergoes a transformative metamorphosis, this dramatic tale artfully weaves together themes of self-discovery, rebirth, and inner strength. Audiences are captivated by the lush cinematography and stunning visual effects, which lend an ethereal quality to the film. Expertly directed and featuring a powerhouse performance from the lead actor, this movie has secured its place as an all-time classic.

Released : 1994

Directed by : Marina Grzinic, Aina Smid

Based on the poignant true story of a man paralyzed by a stroke, this visually stunning and profoundly moving drama offers a unique perspective on the resilience of the human spirit. Told from the protagonist's point of view, the film employs innovative cinematography techniques to convey his limited physical abilities while celebrating his vibrant inner world. With its stellar performances and powerful narrative, this film has left an indelible mark on audiences worldwide.

Released : 2007

Directed by : Julian Schnabel
